episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the vast length of Britain's hedges, a massive model of the Mississippi River built by WWII prisoners of war, the use of the term 'Dark Ages' by historian Ken Dark, and the unique metal used for Grammy Awards called Grammium.

facts.fact: If you took all the hedges in Britain and laid them end to end, they would stretch to the moon and most of the way back.
In the 1940s, prisoners of war in the US helped build a model of the Mississippi basin that was about twice the size of the Vatican.
One of the few historians to use the term Dark Ages is Professor Ken Dark.
The metal used to make Grammy Award trophies is called Grammium.
